New Records: Gunnar Henderson tied a franchise record for shortstops with his 34th home run
Chris Flexen (2-14) set a major league mark for most consecutive losses in a pitcher’s starts with 20, surpassing Chris Capuano’s record
Key Match Events: Cedric Mullins homered with three RBI
Austin Slater and Henderson each drove in three runs for Baltimore
The Orioles scored six runs in the sixth inning
Mullins hit a two-run homer off Touki Toussaint in the eighth
Pre-Game Insights: The Orioles had their most prolific offensive day since scoring a season-high 17 runs on June 20 against the Yankees
Chicago is on its third-longest skid this season after slides of 21 games from July 10 to Aug. 5 and 14 from May 22 to June 6
Post-Match Reflections: Slater said that the Orioles’ offense was the one they believe they are, and it was fun to see it come out today
Baltimore manager Brandon Hyde said that hopefully this gives their hitters some confidence
Hyde said that Webb is likely to make at least one more rehab outing
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles had their most hits since collecting 18 at Houston on June 21
Chicago is on pace to finish 36-126, which would be the second-most defeats behind the 1899 Cleveland Spiders at 20-134
The White Sox have lost 15 of 16 and 41 and 45
Others: Baltimore selected the contract of INF/OF Nick Maton from Triple-A Norfolk and designated C David Bañuelos for assignment
White Sox: INF Brooks Baldwin (right hand), who hasn’t played since Wednesday, took batting practice
Orioles: RHP Jacob Webb (elbow inflammation) threw a scoreless inning with a walk Sunday in a rehabilitation appearance for Triple-A Norfolk
